Package main

Class Interaction

java.lang.Object
main.Interaction
public class Interaction extends Object
Represents the interaction between the user and the game environment. Manages the game flow, team management, purchasing, and playing matches. Provides methods for setting up the game, initializing the team, retrieving options, playing matches, and more. Also manages game balance, weeks, random events, and opposition team names.

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      public void setUp()
      Sets up the game environment by loading athlete and item data from files.

    • shouldEndGame

      public boolean shouldEndGame()
      Checks if the game should end.
      Returns:
      true if the game should end, false otherwise.

    • shouldTakeBye

      public boolean shouldTakeBye()
      Checks if the user's team should take a bye.
      Returns:
      true if the team should take a bye, false otherwise.

    • setUp

      public void setUp(String name, int duration, int difficulty)
      Sets up the game environment with the specified name, duration, and difficulty. Calls the setUp() method and initializes the game environment.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the game environment.
      duration - The duration of the game season.
      difficulty - The difficulty level of the game.

    • initializeTeam

      public void initializeTeam(ArrayList<Athlete> athletes)
      Initializes the team with the specified list of athletes. Uses the Purchase class to buy athletes and assigns them to the team. Resets the game balance after initializing the team.
      Parameters:
      athletes - The list of athletes to initialize the team with.

    • getMarket

      public PurchasableManager getMarket()
      Returns the PurchasableManager.
      Returns:
      The PurchasableManager object.

    • getResultMessage

      public String getResultMessage()
      Returns the result message of the last match.
      Returns:
      The result message.

    • getRandomEventMessage

      public String getRandomEventMessage()
      Returns the random event message.
      Returns:
      The random event message.

    • getSeasonDuration

      public int getSeasonDuration()
      Returns the selected season duration.
      Returns:
      The selected season duration

    • getAthleteOptions

      public ArrayList<Athlete> getAthleteOptions(boolean initializing)
      Retrieves a list of athlete options for the team initialization. Returns a specified number of athlete options based on whether it is the initial team setup.
      Parameters:
      initializing - A boolean value indicating whether it is the initial team setup.
      Returns:
      The list of athlete options.

    • getItemOptions

      public ArrayList<Item> getItemOptions()
      Retrieves a list of item options available in the market.
      Returns:
      The list of item options.

    • getFullTeam

      public ArrayList<Athlete> getFullTeam()
      Retrieves the full team, including team members and reserves.
      Returns:
      The full team.

    • getBoughtItems

      public ArrayList<Item> getBoughtItems()
      Retrieves the list of bought items by the team.
      Returns:
      The list of bought items.

    • getGame

      public GameEnvironment getGame()
      Retrieves the game environment object.
      Returns:
      The game environment object.

    • getOpTeamName

      public ArrayList<String> getOpTeamName()
      Generates a list of random opposition team names.
      Returns:
      The list of random opposition team names.

    • remainingWeeks

      public int remainingWeeks()
      Retrieves the remaining weeks in the game season.
      Returns:
      The remaining weeks.

    • buy

      public String buy(Athlete athlete, String position)
      Buys an athlete and assigns them to the specified position in the game. Checks if the balance is sufficient and if the position is already filled.
      Parameters:
      athlete - The athlete to buy.
      position - The position to assign the athlete to.
      Returns:
      A message indicating the success or failure of the purchase.

    • sell

      public void sell(int objectID, int type, String position)
      Sells the specified object based on the object ID, type, and position. Uses the Purchase class to sell items or athletes from the game environment.
      Parameters:
      objectID - The ID of the object to be sold.
      type - The type of the object (1 for item, 2 for athlete).
      position - The position of the athlete to be sold.

    • buy

      public String buy(Item item)
      Buys an item from the market and adds it to the game. Checks if the player's balance is sufficient to buy the item.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to be bought.
      Returns:
      A message indicating the success or failure of the purchase.

    • fillPosition

      public void fillPosition(Athlete reserve)
      Fills the specified position with the given reserve athlete. Determines the required numbers for each position and checks if the position is not already filled. Removes the reserve athlete, assigns the position, and adds the athlete to the team.
      Parameters:
      reserve - The reserve athlete to be assigned to a position.

    • playGame

      public void playGame(OppositionTeam opTeam)
      Plays a game against the specified opposition team. Manages game logic, including checking for insufficient players, injuries, and match results. Handles random events during gameplay.
      Parameters:
      opTeam - The opposition team to play against.

    • specialTraining

      public void specialTraining(int index, String position)
      Performs special training on an athlete at the specified index and position. Refills the team's stamina, increases the athlete's stats based on the difficulty level, and reduces the week. Checks if the week count reaches zero to end the game.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the athlete.
      position - The position of the athlete.
